column3: str
Nanamo appears to be reassessing her plans.
Speak with Hancock in Kugane.
Speak with Nanamo in Ul'dah.
Speak with Nanamo at the Waking Sands.
Speak with Nanamo.
<Emphasis>Profit</Emphasis>... The thought never even crossed my mind.
But standing about lamenting my naivety will not do anyone any good. I shall consider my lesson learned, and press on.

<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>─are you perchance acquainted with any successful merchants? If my attempt at philanthropy is obliged to reap a profit, it would seem wise to consult someone with a knack for business.

Hm... Ordinarily, I would not trust any agent of the East Aldenard Trading Company─but if you hold this Hancock fellow in high esteem, I am content to be led by you. You may repay my faith by journeying to distant Kugane and speaking with him on my behalf.

Eager though I am to visit those shores, I have not the leisure for a lengthy sea voyage. Now, assuming you will travel as adventurers are wont to do, I shall await your report by the aetheryte in Ul'dah. A fair journey to you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>─and a <Emphasis>swift</Emphasis> one, if you please.
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! To what do I owe the pleasure? Or are you here on business?
...I beg your pardon? Her Grace the sultana would have <Emphasis>my</Emphasis> opinion on how best to invest the wealth of Ul'dah?
My dear <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>... I have you to thank for this...recognition, I am sure. And I am flattered that you came to me. Truly flattered.

But why settle for a lowly apprentice, when you could have the master! Upon matters of profit, there is no living soul better-qualified to advise Her Grace than Chairman Lolorito─a man whose morning “exertions” are said to fill his garderobe with gold!

I should be happy to arrange a meeting for you...say, at the Scions' former headquarters in Thanalan? The Waking Sands would seem a suitably <Emphasis>neutral</Emphasis> venue for negotiations, don't you think? Fare you well, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, and may your dealings prove fruitful!
You will not find a shrewder merchant than Chairman Lolorito. Would that I could be present to witness the back-and-forth of your coming negotiations!
Welcome back, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Did your merchant friend have any useful advice to share?
...With <Emphasis>Lolorito</Emphasis>!? And you agreed to this!?
I am well aware of his standing in the field of business. But I had hoped to keep the Monetarists at arm's length, and <Emphasis>him</Emphasis> in particular...
...Nay. I cannot live in fear of the man. I must learn how to treat with him if I am to rule Ul'dah effectively.
Very well! I will meet with Lolorito. Let us go on ahead to the Waking Sands, and prepare for his coming.
So this is where the Scions first congregated... I have heard many tales, but never had occasion to visit.
To work, then. The hour of the meeting draws near, and I would gather my thoughts. Pray see to it that we have the appointed room to ourselves.
<sigh> I fear it will be many years before I feel comfortable taking part in such negotiations.

But I shall not complain. We have piqued Lolorito's interest and secured his invaluable expertise.
Thank you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. I could not have done it without you.
